results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.

results.title: [Churchill Island]
results.brief_description: No title or credits available. An overview of the history of Churchill Island which was purchased by the Victoria Conservation Trust in January 1976 to be kept for the people of Victoria. It is a small island in size, yet large in both historical and conservation significance. Situated in Westernport Bay near Phillip Island, Churchill Island was first discovered on 5th January, 1798 by George Bass. A detailed booklet accompanies this film.

results.title: A Day at the Ascot Vale School No 2608
results.brief_description: Portrays the outdoor life at a school in the 1920s. Shows school dress, assembly, physical training, organised dancing and games. Junior Red Cross activities, Mothers Club and School Committee.

results.title: Yolngu boy
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Gordon Glenn, Patricia Edgar, Burrundi Pictures and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Caught in a collision between the modern world of rap, football, and street cred and the oldest living culture on earth, Lorrpu, Botj and Milika are three Yolngu teenagers who once shared a childhood dream of becoming great hunters together. But things have changed and their paths are diverging. Botj is walking on the wild side, a lost soul in search of a place to belong. Milika is more interested in football and girls than any of the traditional knowledge he is being taught. Only Lorrpu seems to care about the dream any more. Their paths are diverging, and he is the only one who can see it.

When Botj goes too far and finds himself on the wrong side of both black and white laws, Lorrpu must weigh up his own future against saving his friend.

He persuades the boys to trek to Darwin to argue Botj’s case with Dawu, a tribal leader. Leaving behind their community, they journey through the unforgiving wilderness of north-east Arnhem Land to Darwin. To survive, Lorrpu, Milika and Botj must draw on the ancient bush knowledge they were taught as boys and, most importantly, the bonds of their friendship.

Yolngu Boy is about the search for identity, making the journey from adolescence to adulthood and the implications of belonging to a larger social group, whether it is a culture, a family or a group of friends.

results.title: Bootmen [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dein Perry, Hilary Linstead and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Loosely based on director Dein Perry’s early life as a dancer, “Bootmen” is the story of two brothers - Sean (Adam Garcia) and Mitchell (Sam Worthington) - working in a steel mill in the industrial city of Newcastle. Both dream of one day escaping from the mill, Sean as a tap dancer in Sydney and Mitchell purchasing a tow truck to get out of the only life their stern father has ever known. Tension arrises between the brothers when Sean quits the mill to go to Sydney to study with a well known dance troupe and Mitchell moves in on Sean’s woman, Linda (Sophie Lee), both brothers finding themselves in love with her. “Bootmen” is a feel-good movie that is similar in genre to “Strictly Ballroom” and “The Full Monty”, a touching and sweet film with wonderful tap dancing sequences. Cast also includes William Zappa, Richard Carter and Susie Porter.

results.title: Chopper [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Michele Bennett and Palace Films
results.brief_description: This AFI award winning film is based on the life of Mark Brandon - “Chopper” - Read, a notorious Australian criminal who became a best selling author, publishing 9 books of his life and times as a key stand man in Melbourne’s underworld. Eric Bana plays Chopper following his conviction for abducting a judge who was proceeding over the case of his best friend, Jimmy Loughnan (Simon Lyndon). Read ends up serving a 16 year sentence for his efforts, during which he shares a cell with Jimmy and has to contend with Keithy George (David Field), a crime boss who runs the prison. After an attack of violence instigated by Chopper, he kills Keithy and finds himself the target of numerous prisoners wishing revenge on him. As he sees it, the only way to escape the notorious H division is to get his friend to chop his ears off so that he can be transferred to another prison. Eight years later, Chopper is released and finds himself battling his own personal demons and psychotic episodes to try and adjust to outside life. All he can focus on is seeking revenge on arch enemy Neville Bartos (Vince Colosimo) and looking out for his girlfriend, Tanya (Kate Beahan). This special edition includes deleted scenes, theatrical trailer and footage of director Andrew Dominik and Eric Bana’s visit to Chopper in Tasmania while researching the film.

holdings.name: DVD; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: The Sum of us [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Geoff Burton, Kevin Dowling, Hal McElroy, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Harry (Jack Thompson) is a widower whose life centres around getting his gay son, Jeff (Russell Crowe), to settle down with a nice man. They live together in working-class Sydney, sharing a home, a few beers and a shared bemusement about the rites of masculinity (both straight and queer) in the post-sexual revolution 1990s. Based on David Steven’s award-winning play, “The Sum of Us” is a wonderful comedy about sons and fathers, a loving tribute to the tenderness and comraderie that can be found between men. Though some gay and lesbian critics disliked the film because of its obvious stage-bound script and the unashamed masculinity of Crowe’s gay son, by focussing on working class rather than bourgeois sexuality, “The Sum of Us” can also be seen as a film that radically redefines the boundaries of Australian masculinity and sexuality. Crowe makes a handsome and likeable central character and Jack Thompson is wonderful as the committed, generous father willing to do whatever it takes to make his son happy.

results.title: Breaker Morant [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: It is 1901, South Africa. The British war against the Boers has deteriorated into bitter guerilla warfare. A unit of the Bushveldt Carbineers, made up mainly of Australians, is ordered by the British High Command to fight the Boers on their terms and take no prisoners, orders that were to prove fatal for Harry Morant. Cast includes Edward Woodward, Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, John Waters and Charles Tingwell.

results.title: Sunday Too Far Away [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Matt Carroll, Gil Brealey and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.
